title: Do not skip stakeholder alignment in Kickoff
summary: We rushed through kickoff without clarifying success criteria. Different stakeholders had conflicting expectations, leading to rework and frustration. Lesson: invest in alignment upfront.

incident.what_happened: Kickoff was cut short due to scheduling pressure. Later in the project, stakeholders revealed they had different definitions of success and scope. This led to delays and scope creep.
incident.root_cause: Stakeholders were not aligned on success criteria at kickoff.

impact.description: We lost the client because of this.

guidance.do_not_do: Do not start project work without confirming all key stakeholders share the same definition of success.
guidance.do_instead: Run a kickoff alignment workshop where each stakeholder states expectations, risks, and success criteria.
